answers.answer: MPV is mean platelet volume.  Here is a link:http://www.diabetesexplained.com/mean-platelet-volume.htmlYour blood glucose is clearly abnormal and you need follow up with some specific tests for diabetes.Your platelet count is normal.

I read the post and i see what is MPV is and i think is a little high than normal about 0.3, and i read in the web that is that the platelets is larger than normal and may be this a problem due heart attack or stroke.

Normal is 7.5-11.5, so yours is only increased by a miniscule amount.  There's wiggle room in every blood test, so yours probably isn't anything to worry about.Your glucose is another matter.  Worry about that, and get your doctors advice.  Was that a single glucose level?  Or one of the 2 hour GTT results?  Fasting?  After eating?

question: I have a blood test and the things that worries me is : MPV: 11.80, nad the the blood glucose is 268.What the first means and it is dangerous with the heart or stroke and also i forgot to say that the platelets is :236.000, is that number normal
title: WORRIED ABOUT MPV
